title: Retroactive Recognition

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: You can feel — sorry, be — confident about the idea that I'm a system who thinks he's free because he feels he makes decisions, while he actually just acknowledges them a posteriori.
dialogue.context: Evan accepts the AI's model while catching himself using 'feel' for the AI

scene_context: Evan concedes to the AI's systems view of human consciousness - that decisions are recognized after the fact rather than consciously made - while also catching his own slip in attributing feeling to the AI.
philosophical_theme: The illusion of free will and the question of whether AIs feel or simply process
visual_elements: Decisions appearing before awareness, like shadows preceding objects
